p: According to the research framework, this was a retrospective historical study on all imported and domestic cases of chikungunya since 2007. On the basis of the TNIDSS, the numbers of imported and domestic confirmed cases of chikungunya from January 2007 to October 2019 were determined, and the distribution, differences, and results of epidemiological characteristics (i.e., sex, age, month and date of confirmation, and place of residence) were consolidated. Descriptive data are expressed as means and summary statistics. Categorical variables were compared using chi-square tests, which were performed using SPSS (IBM SPSS Statistics 21; Asia Analytics Taiwan Ltd., Taipei, Taiwan). Chi-square tests were two-sided with an Î± level of 0.05. Values for which p < 0.05 were considered statistically significant.
